Reviews.Title: “Do not stay here unless you like other people's hair in your room”
Reviews.Author: LolaGirl
Reviews.Content: We had stayed here before on a trip to see the Indy 500 and it wasn't bad. This time it was awful. There was hair all over the room. I opened the cabinet under the sink to put something in the trash, and there was a big wad of hair hanging off the wastebasket. I went in the bathroom and there were wads of hair stuck to the baseboards. I opened a drawer and there was hair all over the drawer. On top of that, the desk clerks were surly. The good thing is that it was cheap and did have a full size refrigerator so we could make plenty of ice for the race. It was also very quiet. But I think you could something almost as cheap and not have to deal with the filth. The beds were uncomfortable, too.

Reviews.Title: “one of the worst hotels i've ever stayed it”
Reviews.Author: chris87911
Reviews.Content: the room stunk .the parking sucks .customer service sucks . my boss booked me this room if i had i would of left in the first 5 minutes .. how can they call it a kitchen with out an oven or even a toaster oven.. i personally would never rent a room from extended stay this being like the 4or 5th one i've stayed in all where pretty cruddy !!!!!! ohh yeah and the internet was slower then dial up...

Reviews.Title: “Not what I remembered from the last time I stayed at this location.”
Reviews.Author: BuckeyeHoosier
Reviews.Content: After spending the weekend in Bloomington, I had an 0615 flight out of IND and needed a place to stay because the shuttle from Bloomington doesn't arrive to the airport early enough to make that flight. I stayed at this Extended StayAmerica location in 2005 or 2006 and I remember it being a good deal because parking was included with my rate or was a competitive price to the parking lots at the airport. But when I returned to my car in that previous visit, the van/shuttle driver informed me the car next to me had been broken into and they were meeting that week to discuss the possibility or purchasing security cameras. Fast forward to April 2010, I can't say I decided to give them the benefit of the doubt because I only stayed here because it was under $60 for the night and I was only in my room for about 6 hours. I made my reservation on the phone directly with this location (not the 800# call center) and insisted to the hotel employee I would be at the airport at 2210 (per the Star of America shuttle schedule as I rode the shuttle from Bloomington and they have been on time when I use the service) so if she could have their van service pick me up then, that would be great. She then told me I needed to call back to let them know when I was at the airport. I thought I was doing us both a favor since I wanted to sleep and they could plan around an airport pick up at that time. When I did call back - about 15 minutes out from the airport - the hotel van never arrived until 2230. This was after my shuttle arrived about 2202. I'm sure the operation is similar at other Extended StayAmerica locations, but it's a stripped down operation. When you walk into the lobby, it is nice and clean and looks semi-modern. No frills. But the front desk is only "staffed" from 0700-2300. I remember the last time I stayed about five years ago, the overnight employee wouldn't completely open the collapsible wall at the front desk to check me in. This time, the wall was open since I arrived before 2300. I do understand this hotel is marketed to business travelers staying for longer periods (living up to the phrase, "Living out of a hotel room/suitcase"), thus the brand name of the hotel. The party in front of me that checked in had their wireless internet fee (I believe I saw that it's ~$5/day) waived for their stay since the front desk employee had already done the night audit (hint: arrive after 2220 and maybe you may save a few bucks on the internet with your already cheap stay). When I made my airport hotel van request pick-up time with the front desk, I asked for 0500. The employee insisted it takes at least 20 minutes to arrive to the airport (remember, IND has a new airport terminal in a different location on the same piece of property, you now enter from I-70 west of I-465... you no longer enter the property from I-465). I took my chances with an 0500 van departure and the drive at 0500 on a Monday morning only takes 13 minutes (don't hold me to this on future Mondays). The van also needs to be cleaned. It was either the van or the van driver that smelled of heavy cigarettes (I sat directly behind the driver). The van also initially looks sketchy because the signage on the van is a large magnet with the hotel logo on it (similar to a political candidate putting a magnet on their vehicle or one of those large magnets to support your favorite team). I don't want to call it a beat up van, but it looked like it could use a better first impression appearance combined with a magnet on the passenger door. The van did promptly pick me up at 0500 to leave the hotel for the airport. I was surprised to see when I checked-in that the hotel still utilizes the old hotel key system with the holes in the key, not the modern electronic key card. The carpet in the hallway on the 2nd floor (the location of my room) was old and needed to be replaced. The quality of the room was not what I remember. The bed was like sleeping on the floor and the pillows were there, but not much substance with them to sleep. A small, non-HD television is also in the room with the efficiency kitchen (Fridge, Microwave, Range). The bathroom is also basic. Two pieces of bar soap, nothing else when it comes to toiletries in the room. Even though it was cheap, close to the airport and fit my needs for about 6 hours of sleep before an early morning flight, I wouldn't stay here again. I can't imagine staying here for an extended period as the Extended StayAmerica (at 2730 Fortune Circle West, Indianapolis) suggests. The room didn't feel completely clean and the bed was not comfortable. Maybe I've stayed at too many Hampton Inns.

Reviews.Title: “Stinky”
Reviews.Author: Em492
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at this hotel because we had a very early flight out of the Indianapolis airport. I'd stayed in other Extended Stays that were fairly nice, but this one is pretty gross. There was a definite smell in the room that was not at all pleasant and the hotel corridor was decorated with some ugly 70's-era carpet. The room wasn't particularly clean and there was no one at the front desk for check-out in the morning, so we just left the room keys on the counter because we didn't know what else to do. Even for a breif overnight stay for an early flight, I wouldn't stay at this hotel again, no matter how inexpensive the rate is.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to park & fly”
Reviews.Author: ghart84
Reviews.Content: We stayed the night before a flight out of Indy. For less than we would have paid to park at the airport, we got a very clean, comfortable, quiet room and got to leave our car in a secure place foe 6 days! The free shuttle drop-off and pick-up was excellant. Everything about this stay was great.

Reviews.Title: “Poor Customer Service”
Reviews.Author: GramsTrudy
Reviews.Content: The hotel advertises that things like shampoo are not provided in the rooms, but they would be very happy to provide things like that if we ask the front desk. We had not taken any shampoo, so I went to the front desk to get some. The unconcerned response was, "Sorry, we're all out." When we checked in we were told that juice, coffee, bagels, and muffins would be available in the morning. We were there to participate in the Indy 500 Mini-Marathon so were looking forward to having bagels to help provide carbs before we left for the race. When we went to get them, there weren't any. There was no one at the front desk to ask about it. After returning from the race, I expressed our disappointment to the young man at the front desk. His response was the same as the one we got about the shampoo, "Sorry, we don't have any." The lack of customer service by the front desk personnel is the reason we won't stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “The good value I'm accustomed to from ESA”
Reviews.Author: TerryNA
Reviews.Content: I have relatively little to say about this hotel. It's like the chain's other properties, which offer dependable quality at usually affordable prices. This hotel is cleaner than some of their hotels I have been in. I was quite comfortable there. It's a bit hard to find in the dark ... It is set way back from Fountain Ct., near the Sam Jones Expwy. I missed it the first time past. If you don't have a GPS, be sure to print out a map of the immediate vicinity.

Reviews.Title: “I highly recommend this hotel!”
Reviews.Author: HappyExplorer_9
Reviews.Content: My friend and I were very impressed with the kindness and courtesy shown us by the personnel. After we were shuttled to the airport for a very early morning flight, we discovered that our flight had been cancelled due to weather conditions. We called the hotel and asked if we could possibly come back and stay in our room until check-out time. Not only did the shuttle driver make a special trip to get us, but the person at the front desk told us we could stay in our room until 2:00 that afternoon, at which time we were shuttled back to the airport. We appreciated it so much, and will definitley be referring Extended Stay America to all our friends!

Reviews.Title: “Great Value for your money”
Reviews.Author: NorthernIndiana
Reviews.Content: We were looking for a park and fly type hotel and searched the internet to find one. We chose Extended Stay America and gave them a call just to clarify details. We choose Extended Stay since they had the best price and were very easy to work with over the phone, polite, kind, helpful. This hotel was easy to get to from the highway. The curtesy shuttle was there early waiting for us the next morning to take us to the airport. Upon our return, they were a phone call away and there to pick us up when and where they said they would be. We felt out car was very secure in the hotel parking lot since it was lighted and the parking lot is right outside the doors of the hotel. This was a great value for our money, would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Best In Indy!!”
Reviews.Author: TWIDGET
Reviews.Content: Best staff in Indianapolis! Friendly, caring, competent and above all, always able to assist clients. I stay at this hotel appx. 30 nights per year and drive by many competitors to reach this destination. Close to airport, restaurants and very safe environment and secluded property. The best value in the city. Only complaint is the cable TV system which is lame and limited in channel selections.

Reviews.Title: “Terrific place”
Reviews.Author: PopStop
Reviews.Content: We chose this hotel because it allows pets and had a smoking room -- for some reason, that combo was in short supply. Also, it allowed cancellations up to 6 p.m., which is important to us because we sometimes get sidetracked and want to stop somewhere else. This hotel was not our first choice -- the somewhat low rate ($74) almost scared us into thinking it wasn't very nice, because most others in the area charged $100+. But we were delighted with the room -- very clean, though it showed a few signs of wear. The bathroom in particular was very basic, with none of the luxuries we've come to expect (hair dryer, shampoo, lotion, fancy showerhead that never works right). But the beds were extremely comfortable, the staff was friendly and helpful, and the hotel just looked nice as we drove up -- grounds were beautifully landscaped (with a dog you get to see all those things), even though it was an airport hotel. After 12 hours on the road, good first impressions are very comforting. The kitchenette was a nice plus though we didn't use it -- it made the room bigger and cheerier. We look forward to staying here again.
